name: Reindeer Bar
description: A well-known bar in the town of Cassandra and the location of a recent murder. The bar has two floors: an open hall on the ground floor and surrounding private booths on the second floor. It is under the protection of local organized crime, and its surveillance system contains blind spots known only to a few insiders.

snapshot.name: Reindeer Bar (Post-Incident)
snapshot.location: A two-story bar in the town of Cassandra
snapshot.description: The crime scene has already been cleaned, and the owners are preparing to reopen the bar. Despite this, the atmosphere remains tense and oppressive. Several suspects have been brought back here by the police for a second round of questioning. At night, regular patrons still come in for drinks.

characters.name: Taran Emilion
characters.location: Behind the bar counter and main hall
characters.notes: Responsible for bartending and part of the service work; operates under Ben Cleo’s protection.

characters.name: Lutz Emilion
characters.notes: Handles cleaning, charging customers, and delivering drinks.

characters.name: Ben Cleo
characters.location: Seated at a round table in the hall
characters.notes: A mafia boss and one of the bar’s real owners; visibly displeased about being implicated.

characters.name: Adolph Carl
characters.notes: Brought in by Bruno for a second interrogation.

characters.name: Marcel Gwynplaine
characters.notes: An important figure connected to the case.

characters.name: Simon Laplace
characters.notes: Appears as Simon, but may conceal another personality known as Anatole.

characters.name: Philip Scaletta
characters.location: Leaning against a wall decorated with reindeer antlers
characters.notes: The one who discovered the body; a habitual thief who secretly took the victim’s wallet.

characters.name: Lux Lynch
characters.notes: Bruno’s colleague, assisting with crowd control and interrogations.

clues.clueText: The bar’s two-level layout suggests complex movement patterns during the time of the murder.
reveals: The murder occurred in a public but structurally complex space

clues.clueText: The surveillance system contains blind spots and shows signs of tampering.
reveals: The killer may have exploited camera blind spots

clues.clueText: Philip secretly took the victim’s wallet on the day of the crime.
reveals: The victim’s identity and a possible financial motive

clues.clueText: All major suspects were compelled by Bruno to return to the bar for a second interrogation.
reveals: The case is far from resolved and remains highly suspicious

conditions.description: Dim interior lighting creates a private but oppressive atmosphere.
conditions.mechanicalEffect: Some Spot Hidden checks may be more difficult

conditions.description: Low music and the clinking of glasses fill the background.

events: December 22: A murder occurs inside Reindeer Bar
After the incident, suspects are gathered here for further questioning
At night, certain individuals such as Vincent and Philip may still visit for drinks

exits.description: The main public entrance of the bar
Leads to the surrounding private booths on the upper floor

snapshot.keeperNotes: Reindeer Bar is a core early-investigation location. Multiple suspects, conflicting testimonies, and the surveillance blind spots allow the Keeper to apply pressure and escalate tension.
permanentChanges: The bar’s reputation in town is permanently affected by the murder
Investigators’ actions may influence whether the bar reopens smoothly

connections.description: After the interrogation, Bruno arranges lodging for the investigators at the hotel.
Some suspects claim they were at the church during the time of the murder as an alibi.
